segments.text: I notice the woman standing by the sink, focused on her plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s in her dress and apron, looking so everyday.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water’s pouring out though, making a huge spill.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s sad she doesn’t see it, ruining the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot’s in the water, but she’s unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then there’s the boy on the stool, grabbing cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He looks determined, but that stool is wobbling badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If he falls, it’ll be terrible on that slippery floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s reaching up, so hopeful for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re sharing a secret moment, kind of sweet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the overflow could make everything worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside seems so peaceful in comparison.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for what might happen next.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This obliviousness is heartbreaking in a way.
segments.speaker: PAR
